title: Definition of Total Probability
text: Since P(x) represents the probability and the total probability must sum up to one, we can add up P(x) for all values of $$x$$ (-6 and 10) to get $$1$$. Since we already know $$P(10)=\frac{1}{3}$$, we know that $$P(Lose)=P(-6)=1-P(10)$$.

title: Determining Lose's P(x)
text: What is the value for P(x) for lose?
